29 
30 #include <cstdlib> // for std::abs()
31 #include "Bancroft.hpp"
32 #include "MiscMath.hpp"
33 #include "Matrix.hpp"
34 #include "Vector.hpp"
35 
36 using namespace std;
37 using namespace gpstk;
38 
39 namespace gpstk
40 {
41 
42  /* 'Data' Matrix of data containing observation data in rows, one
43  * row per observation and complying with this format:
44  * x y z P
45  * Where x,y,z are satellite coordinates in an ECEF system
46  * and P is pseudorange (corrected as much as possible,
47  * specially from satellite clock errors), all expresed
48  * in meters.
49  *
50  * 'X' Vector of position solution, in meters. There may be
51  * another solution, that may be accessed with vector
52  * "SecondSolution" if "ChooseOne" is set to "false".
53  *
54  * Return values:
55  * 0 Ok
56  * -1 Not enough good data
57  * -2 Singular problem
58  */
59  int Bancroft::Compute( Matrix<double>& Data,
60  Vector<double>& X )
61  throw(Exception)
62  {
63 
64  try
65  {
66 
67  int N = Data.rows();
68  Matrix<double> B(0,4); // Working matrix
69 
70  // Let's test the input data
71  if( testInput )
72  {
73 
74  double satRadius = 0.0;
75 
76  // Check each row of B Matrix
77  for( int i=0; i < N; i++ )
78  {
79  // If Data(i,3) -> Pseudorange is NOT between the allowed
80  // range, then drop line immediately
81  if( !( (Data(i,3) >= minPRange) && (Data(i,3) <= maxPRange) ) )
82  {
83  continue;
84  }
85 
86  // Let's compute distance between Earth center and
87  // satellite position
88  satRadius = RSS(Data(i,0), Data(i,1) , Data(i,2));
89 
90  // If satRadius is NOT between the allowed range, then drop
91  // line immediately
92  if( !( (satRadius >= minRadius) && (satRadius <= maxRadius) ) )
93  {
94  continue;
95  }
96 
97  // If everything is ok so far, then extract the good
98  // data row and add it to working matrix
99  MatrixRowSlice<double> goodRow(Data,i);
100  B = B && goodRow;
101 
102  }
103 
104  // Let's redefine "N" and check if we have enough data rows
105  // left in a single step
106  if( (N = B.rows()) < 4 )
107  {
108  return -1; // We need at least 4 data rows
109  }
110 
111  } // End of 'if( testInput )...'
112  else
113  {
114  // No input filtering. Working matrix (B) and
115  // input matrix (Data) are equal
116  B = Data;
117  }
118 
119 
120  Matrix<double> BT=transpose(B);
121  Matrix<double> BTBI(4,4), M(4,4,0.0);
122  Vector<double> aux(4), alpha(N), solution1(4), solution2(4);
123 
124  // Temporary storage for BT*B. It will be inverted later
125  BTBI = BT * B;
126 
127  // Let's try to invert BTB matrix
128  try
129  {
130  BTBI = inverseChol( BTBI );
131  }
132  catch(...)
133  {
134  return -2;
135  }
136 
137  // Now, let's compute alpha vector
138  for( int i=0; i < N; i++ )
139  {
140  // First, fill auxiliar vector with corresponding satellite
141  // position and pseudorange
142  aux(0) = B(i,0);
143  aux(1) = B(i,1);
144  aux(2) = B(i,2);
145  aux(3) = B(i,3);
146  alpha(i) = 0.5 * Minkowski(aux, aux);
147  }
148 
149  Vector<double> tau(N,1.0), BTBIBTtau(4), BTBIBTalpha(4);
150 
151  BTBIBTtau = BTBI * BT * tau;
152  BTBIBTalpha = BTBI * BT * alpha;
153 
154  // Now, let's find the coeficients of the second order-equation
155  double a(Minkowski(BTBIBTtau, BTBIBTtau));
156  double b(2.0 * (Minkowski(BTBIBTtau, BTBIBTalpha) - 1.0));
157  double c(Minkowski(BTBIBTalpha, BTBIBTalpha));
158 
159  // Calculate discriminant and exit if negative
160  double discriminant = b*b - 4.0 * a * c;
161  if (discriminant < 0.0)
162  {
163  return -2;
164  }
165 
166  // Find possible DELTA values
167  double DELTA1 = ( -b + SQRT(discriminant) ) / ( 2.0 * a );
168  double DELTA2 = ( -b - SQRT(discriminant) ) / ( 2.0 * a );
169 
170  // We need to define M matrix
171  M(0,0) = 1.0;
172  M(1,1) = 1.0;
173  M(2,2) = 1.0;
174  M(3,3) = - 1.0;
175 
176  // Find possible position solutions with their implicit radii
177  solution1 = M * BTBI * ( BT * DELTA1 * tau + BT * alpha );
178  double radius1(RSS(solution1(0), solution1(1), solution1(2)));
179 
180  solution2 = M * BTBI * ( BT * DELTA2 * tau + BT * alpha );
181  double radius2(RSS(solution2(0), solution2(1), solution2(2)));
182 
183  // Let's choose the right solution
184  if ( ChooseOne )
185  {
186  if ( ABS(CloseTo-radius1) < ABS(CloseTo-radius2) )
187  {
188  X = solution1;
189  }
190  else
191  {
192  X = solution2;
193  }
194  }
195  else
196  {
197  // Both solutions will be reported
198  X = solution1;
199  SecondSolution = solution2;
200  }
201 
202  return 0;
203 
204  } // end of first "try"
205  catch(Exception& e)
206  {
207  GPSTK_RETHROW(e);
208  }
209  } // end Bancroft::Compute()
210 
211 
212  // Another version of Compute method to allow calling it with
213  // const Matrix B.
214  int Bancroft::Compute( const Matrix<double>& Data,
215  Vector<double>& X )
216  throw(Exception)
217  {
218  Matrix<double> Datanoconst(Data);
219 
220  return Bancroft::Compute(Datanoconst, X);
221 
222  }
223 
224 
225 } // namespace gpstk
Generated on Sat Mar 22 2014 12:56:46 for GPS ToolKit Software Library by   1.8.4
